header.gameNote: LEGEND'S CLASSIC AT ATLANTIC CITY NJ

article.headline: Rutgers 83, Massachusetts 75
article.story: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J. -- Mike Rosario scored 22 points and Hamady Ndiaye added 14 to lead Rutgers to an 83-75 win over Massachusetts on Friday night in the Legends Classic. Rutgers (3-1) will play the Michigan State-Florida winner on Saturday night. Ricky Harris keyed a late run for the Minutemen (2-3) that wiped out a double-digit deficit and scored 22 points. Anthony Gurley had 19 points. Harris hit a 3-pointer with 1:31 left that sliced the lead to 79-75. Rutgers was able to seal the win from the line and avoid what would have been a disastrous loss after leading by 19 early in the second half. Rosario scored the first 10 points for the Scarlet Knights. Led by Rosario's quick start, Rutgers shot 59 percent from the floor in the first half and made 7 of 10 3-pointers. The Scarlet Knights had lost nine straight games in the series against UMass.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
